subject: Technology
title: Esports: Gaming Becomes a Sport
description: A 60-second lesson on Esports: Gaming Becomes a Sport.

hook.text: Professional gamers now fill stadiums, sign million-dollar contracts, and train like Olympic athletes.

buildup.text: Esports began with small LAN tournaments in the late 1990s. Prize pools were modest and audiences tiny.

discovery.text: Streaming platforms like Twitch let millions watch tournaments live. Esports found its TV equivalent.

twist.text: The average pro gamer retires before 25. Reaction times decline, and burnout from 12-hour practice days is extreme.

climax.text: The League of Legends World Championship draws over 100 million viewers, rivaling the Super Bowl.

punchline.text: Watching people play games is now bigger than most sports.

quiz.question: Why do most esports professionals retire young?
options: They become too wealthy to continue
Declining reaction times and burnout from intense practice
